page.title: 02BUILDINGS
page.content: THE ARCHITECTURE OF THE AREA IS VARIED BUT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE POST WAR HOUSING,THERE ARE SEVERAL CONSTANTS, PARTICULARLY{BUILDING MATERIALS. }THE} LOCAL{GRANITE,VOLCANIC SPILITE}AND {QUARTZ}FORM THE BASIS FOR MUCH OF THE {WALLS.}THERE ARE SEVERAL EXAMPLES OF{SLATE HUNG DWELLINGS}THOUGH THESE ARE THE EXCEPTION IN AN AREA NOT EXPOSED TO THE VAGARIES OF THE CORNISH CLIMATE. THE{ROOFS}ARE MADE OF {DELABOLE SLATE,}THEIR SIZES VARYING FROM SMALL REGULAR CUT SLATE TO VERY LARGE RANDOM CUT RAG SLATE. THE DESIRE TO LIVE IN THE COUNTRY HAS ENCOURAGED PEOPLE TO{CONVERT DISUSED BARNS}AND { {MODERNISE DELAPIDATED COTTAGES. INEVITABLY, THE DEMAND WILL OUTSTRIP THE LIMITED NUMBER OF SITES AVAILABLE THOUGH IN THE PROCESS OF CONVERSION THE STANDARD OF HOUSING IN THE AREA WILL BE IMPROVED.
